main event: An observer in Kettering, Ohio reported seeing a red light brighter than an average star on March 26, 1952, for a duration of 2.5 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as a red light in the southwest,The sighting lasted 2.5 hours,At one point, the observer noted that there was an airplane in the vicinity 15 minutes after the sighting,The observer indicated that the object had solid edges and changed color from amber to red,This report connects with a follow-up communication regarding a sighting on June 8, 1969, identified as the planet Mars.
witness description: The observer described seeing a bright red light, noting its distinct color and behavior in the sky.
